102.heading: Alternative Comic Books, Strips, Etc.--Articles About.
102.title: "The Alternative Comics Cadaver Derby" p. 49-57
102.author: [No author]
notes: History and criticism. I. Strnad, Jan. Call no.: PN6700.C62

103.heading: Alternative Comic Books, Strips, Etc.--Articles About.
103.title: "Alternative Nation"
103.author: Erwin Dejasse
103.appears_in: p. 70-73 in 9e Art : les Cahiers du Musée de la Bande Dessinée, no. 5 (Jan. 2000).
notes: Begins: "Alors que les éditeurs D.C. et Marvel, géants de la bande dessinée mainstream, constatent une érosion spectaculaire de leur lectorat, la bande dessinée alternative s'affirme plus que jamais avec autorité sur le continent nord-américain."

English summary (from p. 151): "Alternative Nation. Whereas publishers such as DC and Marvel, the giants of mainstream comics, are undergoing a dramatic decrease in readership, independent comics are steadily strengthening their influence in North America. Erwin Dejasse browses through the new creations on the other side of the Atlantic."

notes: Brief essay on independent Francophone comics publishers.

105.author: Alvaro Pons ; translation, Derek Petrey
105.appears_in: p. 138-153 in International Journal of Comic Art, v. 5, no. 2 (Fall 2003).

History and criticism. 2. Black and white comics

108.heading: Alternative Comic Books, Strips, Etc.--Articles About.
108.title: "Can Alternatives Sell? And If So, How?"
108.author: by Gary Groth
108.appears_in: p. 7-11 in The Comics Journal, no. 141 (Apr. 1991)
notes: Publication and distribution. 2. Publication and distribution of comics. I. Groth, Gary. Call no.: PN6700.C62no.141

109.heading: Alternative Comic Books, Strips, Etc.--Articles About.
109.title: "Ce que l'Oubapo Révèle de la Bande Dessinée"
109.author: Thierry Groensteen
109.appears_in: p. 72-75 in 9e Art : les Cahiers du Musée de la Bande Dessinée, no. 10 (Apr. 2004).
notes: Begins: "Constitué en 1992 et aussitôt adoubé par l'Oulipo, l'Ouvroir de bande dessinée potentielle a tenu sa première séance de travail, dans les locaux de l'atelier Nawak, début 1993. Dix ans plus tard, quatre Oupus collectifs et un douzaine d'albums individuels représentent un corpus qui témoigne de la fécondité de ce groupe, actuellement composé de François Ayroles, Anne Baraou, Gilles Ciment, Jochen Gerner, Étienne Lécroart, Killoffer, Jean-Christophe Menu et Lewis Trondheim. 9e Art ne pouvait manque de s'associer à ce anniversaire."

English summary (from page 127): "What the Oubapo Tells Us about Comics. Thierry Groensteen, himself a founder (now resigned) of the Oubapo, asks what good the Oubapo has done to comics and especially to our understanding of the medium. He highlights the implicitly educational dimension of many of the Oubapo exercises."

110.heading: Alternative Comic Books, Strips, Etc.--Articles About.
110.title: "Children of Garo : 36 Years of Japanese Alternative Comics"
110.author: Jason Thompson
110.appears_in: p. 154-156 in Expo 2000 (Bethesda, Maryland : The Expo, 2000).

111.heading: Alternative Comic Books, Strips, Etc.--Articles About.
111.title: "Comics"
111.author: compiled by Brad Balfour and Lou Stathis
notes: Cover title: Comics Are It. 1. Alternative comics
History and criticism. I. Balfour, Brad. II. Stathis, Lou. III. Comics Art It. Call no.: ML3533.8.S64v.4no.5

112.heading: Alternative Comic Books, Strips, Etc.--Articles About.
112.title: "En Atelier"
112.author: Dominique Hérody
112.appears_in: p. 76-86 in 9e Art : Les Cahiers du Musée de la Bande Dessinée, no. 8 (Jan. 2003).
notes: Begins: "Trondheim, David B., Boilet, Blain, Guibert, Sfar. Ces têtes d'affiche de la jeune bande dessinée n'ont pas seulement en commun un formidable talent. Ils ont, à un moment ou un autre, travaillé en atelier. L'atelier Nawak, et plus tard l'ataelier des Vosges, ont été le creuset d'une génération exceptionnelle, le lieu de rencontres déterminantes et de collaborations fécondes. Dominique Hérody, qui participa lui-même à cette aventure collective, a mené l'enquête pour en retracer les péripéties multiplies. Cette plongée dans les coulisses de la création relève de la petite histoire mais jette un éclairage déterminant et inédit sur un pan entier de la bande dessinée contemporaine."

English summary (from p. 151): "At the Workshop. Trondheim, David B., Boilet, Blain, Guibert, Sfar, de Crécy, Satrapi. All these young stars of comic art have at some point in their careers, taken part in the life of the 'Atelier Nawak' founded in 1991 (which later became 'l'Atelier des Vosges' when it changed location). A series of interviews with the participants in this collective adventure have permitted Dominique Hérody to retrace the history of this workshop, which has played an essential part in the recent evolution of creative draughtsmanship in France."

113.heading: Alternative Comic Books, Strips, Etc.--Articles About.
113.title: "Gary Groth and Kim Thompson : Interviews with the Heart of the Alternative Comics Industry"/ Ana Merino. p. 31-73 in International Journal of Comic Art, v. 5, no. 1
113.author: [No author]

114.heading: Alternative Comic Books, Strips, Etc.--Articles About.
114.title: "Gentrifying the Alternatives or Alternifying the Mainstream? : Consolidation, Incorporation, and the State of the Comic Strip Satire in Alternative Weeklies, 1985-2000"
114.author: Kerry Soper
114.appears_in: p. 189-201 in International Journal of Comic Art, v. 3, no. 2 (Fall 2001).

115.heading: Alternative Comic Books, Strips, Etc.--Articles About.
115.title: Getting Serious about Comics : Sex, Drugs, Politics, Decay, Death : suddenly the comics aren't just funny business any more
115.author: by David Armstrong.
notes: Detached from: San Francisco Examiner Image, June 7, 1992.

116.heading: Alternative Comic Books, Strips, Etc.--Articles About.
116.title: "L'Irrésistible Ascension de l'Édition Indépendante"
116.author: Jean-Philippe Martin
116.appears_in: p. 22-31 in 9e Art : les Cahiers du Musée de la Bande Dessinée, no. 5 (Jan. 2000).
notes: Begins: "Présents pour la première fois sur un même stand au Salon du Livre de Paris in 1999, une vingtaine de petits éditeurs francophones, comptant parmi les plus actifs comme Amok, Cornélius, Ego comme X, Fréon et bien sûr l'Association, venaient prouver du haut de leurs 500 ouvrages publiés en l'espace de 10 ans, qu'au-delà des plus folles espérances, un véritable renouveau de la bande dessinée de création avait trouvé à s'incarner. Un dossier tirant le bilan des années 1990 exigeait que l'on revînt sur la montée en puissance de ce que l'on désigne souvent comme 'l'édition indépendante' (qu'il serait peut-être plus juste d'appeler, tout simplement, 'les petits éditeurs').

English summary (from p. 150): "The Irresistible Ascension of the Independent Publishers. Amok, the Association, La Cinquième couche, Cornélius, Ego comme X, Fréon, the Requins marteau, 6 Pieds sous Terre: these are some of the main independent publishers that have emerged during the last decade. Small organizations, often founded and run by creators, they maintain an uncompromising conception of creation and produce objects that are distinct from the traditional album. Their rise has been steady, as Jean-Philippe Martin shows. He predicts they will influence the future of comics in general."

117.heading: Alternative Comic Books, Strips, Etc.--Articles About.
117.title: "Look! Up in the Sky! It's a Toon, It's Literature, It's the New Postmodern Comic"

118.title: "New York World Puts Kaz Out to Pasture ; Alternative Weeklies Overcome by New Blood Lust"
118.author: by Michael Dean
118.appears_in: p. 5-9 in The Comics Journal, no. 234 (June 2001).
notes: Article about Kaz, Carol Lay, and cartooning in alternative weeklies in general.

119.heading: Alternative Comic Books, Strips, Etc.--Articles About.
119.title: "La Onomatoepopeya : 7o Encuentro Internacional de Historietistas"
119.author: Ricardo Peláez
119.appears_in: p. 68-74 in Revista Latinoamericana de Estudios sobre la Historieta, v. 2, no. 6 (Junio 2002).
notes: Resumen: "El Taller de Perro resultó un tránsito desde Gallito Comics para los jóvenes artistas que proponían otra alternative de lectura del cómic y que halló un eco favorable en un reducido grupo de lectores, fiel exigente. Hay aquí un ejemplo posible de imitar y obtener resultados en otras fronteras."

Summary: The Taller del Perro is a development from Gallito Comics by a group of young artists who wanted a comics reading alternative, and who found their small group of faithful readers. Here we have an example that can possibly be imitated with good results elsewhere.
Abstracts as printed with the article, with some editing of the English.

125.heading: Alternative Comic Books, Strips, Etc.--Articles About.
125.title: "Taller de Perro : Por una Historieta de Autor : 7o Encuentro Internacional de Historietistas"
125.author: Ernesto Priego
125.appears_in: p. 63-67 in Revista Latinoamericana de Estudios sobre la Historieta, v. 2, no. 6 (Junio 2002).
notes: Resumen: "Breve conocimiento de la batalla emprendida por un editor y un grupo de entusiastas artistas por lograr una prespuesta alternative en un territorio signado por la hegemonía de comercialismo y donde se logró construir un proyecto conciso y coherente a través de Gallito Comics a partir de 1991."

Summary: Since 1991 a publisher and a group of young Mexican artists have worked hard to find an alternative in the field of comics, a territory dominated by commercialism, and have built a very focused and coherent project, Gallito Comics.
Abstracts as printed with the article, with some editing of the English.

notes: Published in conjunction with the exhibition Comics on the Verge, presented at Decker Gallery, Maryland Institute College of Art, Baltimore, Maryland, Jan. 31-Mar. 14, 2004; Sonoma Museum of Visual Art, May 15-July 3, 2004; and the Chicago Cultural Center, Aug. 7-Oct. 3, 2004.

"The exhibition originated at Yerba Buena Center for the Arts, San Francisco as Raw, Boiled and Cooked, part of an umbrella exhibition entitled Fantastic! : the Art of Comics and Illusion, that was on view at YBCA from 27 July-13 October 2002."
